channel.title: Brute-force on Open Operational Research

item.title: Scrabble numbers
item.description: I was reading one of Ian Stewart’s books of popular maths, and I found a potentially incomplete solutuion to a puzzle. Given the (English) Scrable tileset, do any numbers give their own score? “One” certainly doesn’t, since “O”,“N”,“E”each score 1 point, and \(3 \neq 1\). For various reasons, you can see that you don’t need to test every number: Scrabble scores are non-negative integers. Score increases as wordlength increases.
